Reviews.Title: “100% under expectation”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin T
Reviews.Content: Positive sides: - Friendly stuff, we get our room upgrade; - Good price; - Free wifi; - rooms are clean and very well design! - city tour bus and shopping area in 5min walking distance; - 7-9 eur taxi to city heart - hotel looks very new. Ok: - some coctail and vine bars in same building; - nice view Negatives: - no breakfast; - 25-40min walking distance from city center.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would choose somewhere else if returning to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: luv8hotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a recent business trip. The hotel has a modern feel, is clean, and the staff are friendly. My room was well appointed,clean and nicely decorated. It overlooked the pool, which I did not use, nor do I think I would as it is heavily overlooked by apartments. Unfortunately, the comments on previous reviews regarding the air conditioning are true. My room was warm when I arrived, so I put on the air con and left. On return the room was warmer, as only warm air was being circulated by the air con. I mentioned this to the reception staff, who advised that this was due to it being winter, and provided complimentary water. The hotel is not within walking distance of the centre for sight seeing. I had a bit of time to kill, so took the metro to the centre, and the bus back. The hotel staff were helpful with this, and supplied a map. If you like shopping it is conveniently located for the best shops in town. The breakfast was ok, nothing special, and the hotel does not have a restaurant although there is one next door, however as the hotel is located out of the centre, the restaurant did give the feel, that it was used to serving locals rather than visitors. Overall the hotel is ok, but if I return to Barcelona as a tourist I would choose somewhere closer to the centre, with better/more facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Emma853536
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3nights and had a lovely time! Nice location its a very respectable area with businesses/expensive shopping malls nearby. Transportation not a far walk and the hop on/hop off bus stop is just round the corner. We did the blue route one day and the red route the next. We also walked into the tourist area which is a really pleasant walk along the avinguda diagonal then down the rambla de catalunya. Good location for the Nou Camp only 15-20mins walk away. The overall facilities of the hotel are to a high quality. Everything is spotless. The bathroom is modern, very clean with good toiletries. Breakfast was nice and the service was very friendly happy to talk to you and offer you alternatives. We had a great stay and would recommend to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Daquito
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a suite which was beautiful and very spacious. Location was great as you can walk to most places without being on a very touristy area. We had a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Zebra!”
Reviews.Author: DioRangel
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this boutique Hotel! Gran Derby location is not the best however it has indeed a great decor and charm in a sort of Africa mood with Zebra Carpets (replica)! The suite room is very comfortable with beautiful ambiance and great bathroom! The pool facilities are also great. Nearby there are local markets and you can treat yourself with some local jamon, cheese and wine! We arrived at 9am and we had to check in only after 14:30 so that was a bit annoying, plus the staff was not that attentive. Este Hotel Boutique foi formidável. Apesar de não estar localizado em uma área perto das atrações da cidade, possui uma linda decoração e charme único em uma espécie de estilo Africano, com carpetes de Zebra (sintético)! A suite é muito confortável com linda ambientação e ótimo banheiro. A piscina também é ótima. Pelos arredores existem mercados locais nos quais podes encontrar queijos, presunto jamon e vinhos locais. Chegamos às 9:00 da manhã e tivemos que esperar até 14:30 para fazer o check-in, o que foi cansativo. O staff local não foram tão solícitos.

Reviews.Title: “Another hidden gem of the SLH group, location off, but such funky rooms”
Reviews.Author: deepsapphyr
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through the SLH website again standard room booked and again upgraded to a suite, have to admit off season is the way to book these little small luxury boutique hotels. Room was so funky beds a bit small but mattress and linen excellent quality. Breakfast i would say 6 out of 10, service very good, bathrooms massive with jacuzzi as well. Would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptic about the hotel as their low season rates were lower than in much worse "hostales" near Catalunya square. However, I took confidence in their Small Luxury Hotels affiliation and took the plunge. I am really happy that I did, because the Gran Derby turned out to be really nice. It also helped that I was upgraded to a Deluxe room upon my arrival. The room was clean, modern and good sized, separate lounge area with sofa and table, huge closet and great bathroom with both shower and bath. My best impression however was from the staff, always helpful on any request, especially the lady at breakfast, who kept offering more coffee or new pastries. Speaking of which, breakfast was high quality continental option, with real fresh fruit, great ham and Spanish cheeses (including manchego) and assorted pastries. Best of all, lattes and expressos made to order, not that weak filter coffees in many hotels. The only downside was that (possibly my fault, as I didn't ask) the room was a bit warm. In fact, it was warmer than usual for this time of the year, so in most places (like the common areas in the hotel), the heater would be on and you'd feel warm. After trying without success to adjust what I thought was the air conditioner, I resorted to opening the windows as I would come back at night. It only worked for a while though, as the room faced the street and you could not bear the noise and sleep with it open. The good thing about this being out of the beaten track is that this is a quieter location. The local bar and restaurant nearby are neighborhood spots, hence close at a decent hour. The gentlemen clubs nearby are a non issue, as they are closed venues and there is no soliciting outside of any sort. The residual noise during the night was on and off traffic at nearby Sarria avenue, which you probably won't get in a room not facing the street. All in all, this is a very good hotel a bit way from the main touristy spot of the Catalunya square, which it compensates with lower rates and a wide array of dining options nearby. Get yourself a Barcelona transport card and you'll be fine here. I'd certainly consider coming back, and next time ask how to cool off the room!

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Chenyang D
Reviews.Content: My hunsband and myself check into this hotel on the 10/10/11 for 8days for our honeymoon.We had great time with them!The staff are far too helpful and friendly,can not be better! And the hotel iteself is mordern and clean!We would love to let everyone know what a great experience we had and anytime we going to visit Barcelona, we will go back the hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Derby”
Reviews.Author: carinasok
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent about 5 nights at the Gran Derby. We had a great experience and the staff even upgraded our room to a larger suite at a very reduced cost per day. The bathrooms had a state of the art shower/tub and separate shower. Overall the hotel was very clean and had a luxury/boutique feel. Rates are very good if you book more than 2 days so this also ended up being very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not worth the rate”
Reviews.Author: vincentB186338
Reviews.Content: i just came back from the Gran Derby after being there for 4 nights with my Girlfriend in September. the hotel is nice and the staff are friendly, Roberto in particular who was working the night shift was friendly and hellpful and the breakfast lady was lovely unlike some of the others that worked behind the desk. My main concern is the cost of staying there, you would think for paying over 1000 euros for 4 nights you would expect a great hotel and 4 star luxury but this was just not evident. The pool for example is more like a paddling pool - the water came up to my knees and and i could nearly stretch from side to another. We had a sound proof room but i dont quite know what is was sound proof from as our neighbour showered around about 6am in the morning and the noise was so loud it felt like i was in the shower with them. They gym had a running machine, an excecise bike, limited weights and and a sit up bench. The treadmill either was not working properly or had some kind of limiter on it as at top speed on the machine i think a baby could crawl faster. The excerise bike didnt work properly and all looked slightly dated. We then thought lets forget the gym and go to the sauna. This took over an hour to get a sweat on to the point we nearly gave up in there. They did give us a complimentary bottle of wine on arrival which is a nice touch but no water, no kettle, no iron, no music system and the televison only had bbc worldwide news and CNN as their English channels. I would stay here again but at half the price and would classify this as a good 3 star and not a 4 star as advertised. Thanks V

Reviews.Title: “Had money stolen and it wasn't dealt with in the best way”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie H
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that i gave a low rating based solely on my experience of the appalling way in which the theft was handled... On my first morning we popped down to breakfast for about 45mins and I left my bag in the room...to be honest I didn't think that anyone would be cleaning the room so early. When we got back the door was closed but the room was being cleaned when we entered. I looked for my phone and it was in the inner pocket of my bag with the clear pouch of Euros I had picked up before I left England. The strange thing was that the inner pocket was zipped up - something I never do. But I could see my phone and wallet so I thought no more of it. I picked up my bag and we went to the pool for the rest of the day. Later that evening I went to split my money up so that I wasn't carrying all of it out with me. That is when I noticed that 100Euros was missing. It was very clear that it had not been a mistake on my part as I hadn't spent any money until then - having only arrived the night before. I came with 300Euros which I had counted at the foreign exchange...and there was only 200Euros in my wallet. I have never had anything stolen from me in my life and would never say anything unless I was ABSOLUTELY sure there was no other explanation. So, I spoke to the man at reception and explained that I thought money had been taken from the room. Basically the long and short of it is that I ended up speaking with three different staff and some were particularly accusing in their attitude towards me - not great when you've been robbed. They checked the room door records and there was one maid who entered that day. They said that she had been there for years and that she was an exemplary staff member. They put some fruit in our room as a token but did nothing else to acknowledge the experience we had. I ended up going to the police and filing a report but this was just for insurance purposes - although I couldn't claim anyway because the excess was higher than the amount stolen. Part of me admires the fact that they stood by their staff. However, 100Euros was definitely taken from my bag whilst I was at breakfast and the staff were not particularly empathetic to this situation. i would recommend you keep you money on you at all times...and if you do leave it for even ten mins - check the amount when you return. Perhaps this has been going on for a long time and no one has noticed because the full amount is not being taken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Dollos
Reviews.Content: Had a nice and relaxed five nights in the Gran Derby in Barcelona. A small boutique hotel in a non tourist area, just off a main shopping street, Ave. Diagnal. I booked a junior suite. One of two with a private terrace on the sixth floor. The room was nice. Comfortable bed, free wireless internet, great shower. The pool area took the sun from about 11.30 until 15.30. We had the area mostly to ourself for our entire stay, which was great. The pool was small. Great for a dip or to cool down. staff were friendly and helpful. There are several supermarkets within 5 mins walk of the hotel and smaller convieince stores within 2 min. There is a Tapas bar next door, which was very friendly and served good quality food. I'd recomend it to visit during your stay. All in all I'd recomend the Gran Derby.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRStanbrook
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, not too far out of town, but a taxi is the quickest way to get to the centre of all the tourist things. The staff are all really lovely and full of smiles and advice of things to do, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are all beautifully decorated with terrific showers :-) Really lovely very fresh breakfast. You really could do worse than to stay here - well worth it in my humble opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, noisy environment”
Reviews.Author: revival_fanatic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in 2-floor apartment (couple with 1y old child) in the beginning of June. Choice of 2-floor apartment was taken to have some free time while our son sleeps. Unfortunately, like a lot of other hotels in Barcelona, this hotel has very poor sound isolation. So when cleaning started we heard everything. Also a lot such apartments located below ground, thus it is very cold in the apartment (June - remember!). So before going to sleep we had to switch on hot water in bathroom to warm up a bit the apartment. At the same time, staff was quite friendly. When we had a problem due to neighbor who watched TV at 1 a.m. quite loudly, they immediately called him and asked to make the volume lower. Breakfasts are normal (nothing special). Eggs could be ordered and they will be brought to you from neighboring hotel Derby. Fun. And the canteen is quite small (6 tables if I'm not mistaken). There is a swimming pool which we didn't use (can't say anything).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volleychic7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were extremely happy. Had two rooms one for kids and inaws and was perfect. Staff was very good and helpful and rooms very nice. Only complaint was proximity to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: manu4t
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part of the Small Luxury Hotels chain which all were good (we stayed in 2 in Spain and 1 in Portugal while we were on honeymoon). The hotel lobby was clean and the hotel staff were helpful. The room was spacious and clean, housekeeping was excellent. It was located near most of the things we wanted to see and there were several neighborhood bars around the area which served great tapas. Overall I would give it an A-, not an A or A+ in part because the AC in our room was not good. Short of that, everything else was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Fabienne21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated 4 stars which it most definitely is not. It is a reasonable 3 star hotel, no more. The room was adequate, although it lacked basic amenities, a bottle of water on arrival might have been a nice idea particularly as it was supposed to be a 4 star hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The Gym and pool area were disappointing. Internet connection was sporadic and not wireless unless you paid for it, a complete rip off for a so called 4 star hotel. There were 4 brothels in close vicinity to the hotel, so maybe not so suitable for families with children. I wouldn't go back nor recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Day-time service to be applauded - Wi-Fi not to be relied upon”
Reviews.Author: tug66
Reviews.Content: I too experienced the up-sell attempt at registration but was also shown a much better room at same price band which I happily took. I hate hotels that do not provide an iron (for safety reasons??) forcing you to pay for laundry; I hate hotels that do not provide tea/coffee making facilities in-room, forcing you to pay for room service; I hate hotels that claim on their website to have free wi-fi and do not. You have to use a service that allegedly gives you 1 hour free, then I was forced to fork out over 25Euros for 3 days and a very poor reception leading to service breakdown. In my opinion, disgusting in a 4-star hotel. Gran Derby - you're not cheap so don't try to squeeze every last penny out of your clients in other ways. The Times Cafe across the street at the sister hotel does not seem to do evening meals and if they do, it won't amount to much so your choice will be elsewhere. Try the local Tapas bar next door to the right as you exit the hotel. That all said, the weekday reception staff and Andreas the Concierge, were fantastic. My initial settling in gripes were dealt with swiftly and courteously and all in all, I had the best nights sleep ever on the 6th floor. The pool area is very nice and the new gym and sauna also very good. I think the staff are doing a great job but perhaps the hotel group are making some policy choices that I for one would rather avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Staff did their utmost to make the stay here wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kerik4
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week-long, first time visit to Barcelona. We selected the Gran Derby for its family room and location out of the main tourist area. The family room (a duplex with 2 bedrooms) was not to our liking as it was close to reception, but when we talked to the reception manager we were offered a different room which was much more suitable. Very comfortable and clean, the room was stylish and well set-up, and the children loved the jacuzzi! We found that the staff were very friendly and helpful, offering excellent suggestions for restaurants, beaches, general advice (which we needed often!). The lady who runs the breakfast room was also very friendly and, despite being busy, made the children hot chocolate and endless coffee for us. The location is ideal for a short walk to Avinguda Diagonal for shopping and some great restaurants which are a lot cheaper as they are out of the tourist trap, not far to a metro station and as Barcelona is compact everything is a relatively cheap taxi ride away anyway (for a family of four). Overall we recommend the Gran Derby and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The room was hot!!!”
Reviews.Author: merc_amg
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the end of March, the room was very hot 28 degrees during the night, when I asked why the air-con was not working, I was told it gets turned on in the summer! There is a taxi rank in the front of the hotel; I got woken by them on their radios. However the good points are inside the hotel is modern, clean, quiet and breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Classy afforable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mclpcm
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good value, stylish =rooms, quiet; good breakfast Cons: A bit far from the center of town

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Barcelona thanks to Gran Derby Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles73014
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel. Spectacular room with jacuzzi. Lovely and helpfull staff. I had the opportunity to know the Managing Director and she was spectacular too. I recommend this hotel for a nice and calm stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Reports
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as a 'Small leading hotel of the world'. I would question this, as it seems poor compared to other SLH hotels, however, thus said, it was good value for money. We booked a trip on Expedia to include our flight and accommodation. The hotel is located slightly far out from the City Centre but we did walk to the main shopping areas, the Gaudi buildings etc., from the hotel, even though this was quite a distance. The Metro is not very close by either. The hotel is fairly minimalist and we had a duplex. Robes and slippers were provided, and our room towels changed twice a day. The breakfast deal was good value (8 euros each) and comprehensive with meats, cheeses, fruit etc., The room was adequate and the bathroom very comfortable. We did not have a flat screen TV in our room but we did in the living room. There is a small swimming pool here, which is very overlooked by apartment blocks, but nevertheless it was a pleasant place to unwind after the hustle and bustle of downtown Barcelona. The Gran Derby staff were very helpful and pointed us in the direction of some good Tapas Bars which were not too touristy which we appreciated. Another plus was that it was near a Cortes d'Ingles department store! We probably would not stay here again, but it was perfectly adequare for a 4 night break in Barcelona, and not too noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: croissantneuf
Reviews.Content: Now a proper boutique hotel with comfortable suites at really reasonable rates. Couldn't fault anything. Maybe though to beware the rooms on the inside which have windows onto an internal light-well. The upgrade that others have complained about was offered but we were under no pressure to change from the junior suite we had booked

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, excellent room”
Reviews.Author: hatchs
Reviews.Content: Large room with Robe and slippers great part glass walled bathroom and huge suede sofa. Location fine if you don't mind a short walk to the tube station which gives you easy, cheap travel everywhere. Nice restaurants nearby tho not so much at weekends. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk, spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BiaRioLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Derby with 2 children. Location is not great, but easy to get taxis and buses and move around. It is halfway between the stadium, Passeio de Gracia and Montjuic. It is a business/residential area. There are 2 strip clubs a few doors from the hotel, but we never saw any dodgy looking people in the area. (I think they must go out much later than we did!) There is also an AMAZING patisserie around the corner. The first room (duplex) we were given, although very spacious was quite smelly as there is not direct light coming to it. We arrived late and the night porter was nice but not very good at solving problems and giving directions... We changed rooms the next morning to a junior suite. The guys at the front desk (during the day) were extremely nice. They were very good at recommending and booking restaurants, finding train times and giving us directions. The swimming pool is also a bonus at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable hotel - maybe not 4 star though”
Reviews.Author: anna_diamond
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Barcelona for a weekend city break and found this hotel on the internet. We thought the price was reasonable considering some of the prices of other hotels in Barcelona. I was a bit concerned before arriving due to some of the reviews I had read...but was relieved when I got there. I wouldnt say it was totally up to 4 star standards but I was acceptable. I was slight confused when I got there - the hotel seems to be linked to another hotel across the road. I never really got to the bottom of this but I think the restaurant, bar etc is in the hotel across the street. This I wasnt really keen on but we ended up on the la Rambla every evening so it didnt really matter in the end. Our first room was one of the duplex suites - I have to admit I was slightly disappointed with it - the sofa was very worn out looking. The window looked out onto a small tunnel with other rooms facing directly onto it...it just wasnt great. However, like another reviewer we were given the option to upgrade. We were shown 2 different suites and were allowed to choose which one we wanted. We accepted the upgrade and it was 20 euros per night. The upgraded room was far nicer - there was a glass panel from the shower into the bathroom! There was loads of room, a big tv etc Finally I do have to admit that the hotel was quite far out from the city centre. Though we decided to buy a 2 day pass for the hop on hop off bus tour and there was a stop 5 mins away from the hotel so we used that to get about combined with taxis. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Remodeled - Fabulous Stay at a Fabulous Price!”
Reviews.Author: Tapnmel23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in mid-February for 4 nights. We booked it last minute and without doing much research ahead of time. When we arrived, we were told that the hotel has renovated many of its rooms, and that for 20 Euro more per night, we could have an upgraded room. We asked the man at the front desk to show us the non-upgraded room we had reserved as well as the upgraded room available for the additional fee. The upgraded room was amazing! Shiny hardwood floors, plasma television, separate living room with another television and sofa, sunk-in bath tub, animal-print accents, modern lighting fixtures, etc. All for just 20 Euro. We quickly agreed to stay in the upgraded room, since our total cost for the room per night was still only going to cost approximately 140 USD. What a steal for this nice of a room! We stayed in numerous hotels throughout Europe before we got to the Hotel Gran Derby and paid the same price, but got a lot less. The service at the hotel was also great. Every morning we ordered coffee with milk through room service. Our coffee also arrived within ten minutes and was absolutely delicious (and only cost about $10 USD with tip). Although the Hotel Gran Derby is located in a business district, a subway stop is only about a 10 minute walk from the hotel (the stop is Hospital Clinic). Once you get to the subway, you can go anywhere in Barcelona easily, including to the Las Ramblas. Thus, although there are certainly hotels that are more centrally located in Barcelona, you can't beat the value you get at the Hotel Gran Derby. Plus, on the walk to the subway, there are a couple excellent pastry shops which had some of the best sandwiches and treats I have ever had. This makes the walk to the subway something to look forward too :)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, a bit off main sightseeing areas”
Reviews.Author: Stuggi
Reviews.Content: The good news: hotel staff very friendly and helpful; rooms spacious, but not in a real 4 star shape anymore, lots of edges and corners better not to be looked at too carefully; I had a big living room and a separate sleeping room and bathroom upstairs; nice furniture, two tvs (who really needs that?), nice bathroom with stylish amenities; very nice breakfast, not too many choices but really beautifully set up. The bad news: no view out of the windows since the room was minus 0,5 levels from the ground floor (bedroom beeing plus 0,5 levels above the ground floor, but still facing a wall in 2 meters distance); metro stations at least 15 minutes walk, which is not too pleasant to walk in the middle of the night; tramstation nearby, but without connection to the center; neighborhood typical of spanish big cities, but not really a beauty. Next time I would try to stay near the ramblas or placa Catalonia or in Gracia, which is a very nice neighborhood. Barcelona is a great city!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared off based on some of the reviews but the hotel was an amazing deal. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 95 euros a night. The futon in the family room was very comfortable for my husband and I; there was one room with two double beds and another with one single bed. It was perfect for our family of 5. It's a little off the beaten track but with what you save, you can afford a taxi (beware - only 4 people in a taxi; we had to get two anytime we all went together). We stayed at the Hotel Arts for the second half of our vacation and while that was fabulous, we had to get two rooms and one night there was the same as 4 at the Gran Derby! Excellent amenities - little travel bag full of shampoos, etc. It was too cold when we were there to swim so I don't know about the pool. There is a strip club a couple of doors down. My girls (9, 7 and 3) didn't know what it was but just thought I'd give you a heads up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olos
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. After reading the earlier reviews I admit being sceptic, but we were pleasantly surprised. We were met outside by the bellboy who took care of our luggage. The receptionist offered to change our room, we where told and later shown that duplex rooms are on the backside of the hotel and on a lower level. We also had a look at one of the junior suites and two different types of superior rooms. The duplex and the junior suite were a bit gloomy. The newly refurbished superior rooms were both spacious and light. We ended up with a superior room that consisted of a living room connected to the bedroom with hallway that could be closed by a sliding door. The hallway also connected to the bathroom and a walk in closet with a safe and plenty space for suitcases etc. Bedroom faced out to the street. Air-condition only gave hot air during winter so we had to turn it of and air out trough the windows. Bathroom was well appointed. The water pressure was great and there were no lack of hot water. A huge showerhead so you really got wet, or if you rather would sink into the tub noting would stop you from that. The hotel also provided bathrobes, slippers huge soft towels ample assortment of bath products. Dark wooden floors made the room much cleaner. Reasonable prices in the mini-bar. There were flat screen TVs both in the living room (with DVD/DC player) and in the bedroom. From what I understood there are both cabled and wireless internet connections, as I didn’t bring my laptop I would not know how well it works. We did not have breakfast included but there are plenty places for a breakfast just outside the hotel. The hotel is not directly in the city centre. You can walk witch is quite nice lots of shops and places to stop for a coffee. A taxi will set you roughly €5 back. There are a couple of strip clubs close by, we didn’t hear any noise and if you don’t want to pass them you can easily avoid them (we passed them and we were not harassed in any way). We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: hobnob38
Reviews.Content: This blah 4 star was in a great location and cheap, but the rooms look a little dated, the furniture etc looks rough around the edges and the beds were not great. The best thing about the room was the size with a separate living room area and a very nice marble bathroom. It took so long for me to check in that the police came and were going to ticket me while unloading luggage. The hotel manager had to come out and argue with him but he took out his pad and started to write the ticket. It was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel thoroughly”
Reviews.Author: librarianofbabel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little outside the city center but it is worth the taxi or subway ride. The rooms are comfortable, nice, and clean. We had a small living area and a nice little sun room attached to our hotel room over looking the pool. Definitely worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DTLLC
Reviews.Content: We purchased two packages on Luxury Link for a total of 6 nights. Loose the smart car feature on this because if you are not familiar with driving in BN you shouldn't. The service-particularly room service as well as the bell staff are excellent. The room we were assigned was spacious, beautiful, comfortable with excellent amenities. Although there are several adult clubs in the area (Clubs and --- shops abound in Barcelona so you are never too far away), they cause no problem at all. Although the hotel is not right next door to Gucci, it is within 5 minutes walking of the best shops in the world, and 20 minutes walk from everywhere of import in BN with the exception of Mont Juic-so I suppose a 10 minute walk to the metro would be in order. Value is very important, and this hotel gives it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!! No way it is a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealtorSanMateo
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package on Luxury Link and was extremely disappointed with the property. The hotel is a member of small luxury hotels of the world. We have stayed at a number of their properties so I was comfortable making this reservation. Boy was I sorry!! I guess the only requirement for membership is payment. It is in a location surrounded by strip joints. The suite was dark, old and faced a school. Looking at the hanging laundry reminded me of the slum areas in Asia. Get to breakfast early or all you get is scraps. The tiny bath had the intimate type cheap shower curtains which seems to always cling tightly to you. Our package included a number of items including robes. I was not surprised when they tried to give us used ones to take home. This was my first (and last) trip to Barcelona and the Gran Derby did nothing to give us fond memories. Value is relative... this is no deal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside, but lacks service ... !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were first impressed by the terrific room rate we were getting at the beginning of the season and for a duplex room, which is why we chose it. However, it quickly turned to regret as the days went by. The duplex room is dark, dingy, and extremely tiny! Be warned; if you are taller than 6 feet (or close) then your feet will hang off the end as we discovered on our first night. After a rough nights sleep thanks to constant banging, door slamming, and outside noise, we opted to upgrade to a room with a bigger bed. The superior suite is extremely stylish but no attention was paid to guest-friendliness or comfort. The bathroom taps are awkward to use, the square bath is not comfortable and the tap didn't work so I had to fill it up with the hand-held shower nozzle. No slip mats in the shower as I discoverd after using soap and the floor suddenly turned into a slippy-slide and I had to hang on for dear life or risk injury! The soap wasn't replaced daily either and foam bath bottles were left empty. There was alot of grime surrounding the basins and it was obvious the room hadn't been dusted in quite some time. The location of the hotel is not near anything. Metro station is a few blocks away. There is a 'Bus Turistic' stop but even that is a good twenty minute walk away. Room service is a disaster ! The staff refused to speak English and then hung up on us. We placed our order at 19h30 but was told it only opens at 8 p.m. despite the room service card (in clear print) stating the times for room service was from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. The televisions are not tuned, there are two english channels only, CNN and BBC, and there is no video-on-demand. Even the most limited service hotel offers video-on-demand. The lady who checked us in and the man who handled our upgrade were the only ones who could speak basic English. It made it terribly difficult to ask for anything or to get advice on the city. Breakfast is certainly not worth the fifteen euros (Plus taxes) charged. The food served is the same quality as a school canteen; watery, undercooked or overcooked, and powdery eggs, and dissapointing for a 4-star hotel. The pastries were at least nice. The breakfast lady didn't speak English so again it was difficult to giver her our order, which was brought to our table incorrect! On first impression one can certainly tell that alot of effort went into the decor and design of the rooms, pity that the same amount of effort wasn't spent on getting their staff and level of service as good.
